cards.name: Reckless Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: "Any good prospector must sift the gold from the sand."
cards.originalText: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.name: Screaming Seahawk
cards.text:
Flying
When Screaming Seahawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Screaming Seahawk, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The "If you do" means "If you search".

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Screaming Seahawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Screaming Seahawk, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Shoreline Ranger
cards.text:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.

cards.name: Stifle
cards.text: Counter target activated or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor:
"Superior force meets woefully inadequate object. What paradox were you expecting?"
—Azguri, archmage of Evos Isle

rulings.text: An activated ability has a "Cost: Effect" format. Look for the colon. A triggered ability starts with "when", "whenever", or "at".
Turn-based actions and special actions like the normal card draw, combat damage, or turning a face-down creature face up can't be targeted.

It can target delayed triggered abilities. For example, a card that says "Whenever a player cycles a card, you may exile target creature. If you do, return that creature to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step." triggers when a player cycles a card and creates a delayed trigger that happens at the beginning of the end step. You can choose to target the "at the beginning of the end step" trigger when it is placed on the stack at end of turn.

cards.originalText: Counter target activated or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Traveler's Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
When Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

rulings.text: Can affect basic or non-basic types, but it must be for a specific type. The chosen type must be an existing land type. See the glossary of the comprehensive rulebook for more details on existing land types.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
As Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
When Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type.

cards.name: Turn the Tide
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan

rulings.text: Only creatures your opponents control when Turn the Tide resolves are affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Take my hand and dance to the music of the winds."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, your death will be as informative as possible."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
cards.text: Exile Ill-Gotten Gains. Each player discards their hand, then returns up to three cards from their graveyard to their hand.
cards.flavor: Urza thought it a crusade. Xantcha knew it was a robbery.

rulings.text: Players can get fewer than 3 cards if they want.

cards.originalText: Exile Ill-Gotten Gains. Each player discards his or her hand, then returns up to three cards from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

cards.name: Infectious Horror
cards.text: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Infectious Horror's ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Liliana's Specter
cards.text:
Flying
When Liliana's Specter enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"The finest minions know what I need without me ever saying a thing."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Liliana's Specter enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Magus of the Mirror
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Mirror: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: "Behold! The image of the enemy and all that she has. Trust your envy, and take it."

rulings.text: When the life totals are exchanged, each player gains or loses the amount of life necessary to equal the other player's previous life total. For example, if player A has 5 life and player B has 3 life before the exchange, player A will lose 2 life and player B will gain 2 life. Replacement effects may modify these gains and losses, and triggered abilities may trigger on them.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Mirror: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Morkrut Banshee
cards.text: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

rulings.text: The morbid ability is mandatory. If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when the ability triggers (and a creature died this turn), the ability must target Morkrut Banshee itself.

foreignNames.name: モークラットのバンシー

cards.originalText: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Necromantic Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The target is chosen just after any creatures dealt lethal damage at the same time that the enchanted creature dealt damage have been put into the graveyard. That might include the enchanted creature itself, if it had trample and was blocked, for example.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Phage the Untouchable
cards.text:
When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

rulings.text: It is only considered "cast from your hand" if you cast it as a spell from your hand. Putting it onto the battlefield from your hand using a spell or ability will cause you to lose the game.
In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

foreignNames.name: 触れられざる者フェイジ

cards.originalText:
When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

cards.name: Plagued Rusalka
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Quag Vampires
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Quag Vampires enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Swampwalk
Quag Vampires enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Reckless Spite
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.flavor: "The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."
cards.originalText: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

cards.name: Skeletal Scrying
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.
cards.flavor: His family was a small price to pay for the dark gifts that called to him.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Skeletal Scrying, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.

cards.name: Smallpox
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Take away a few things, and a rebellion may ensue. Take away everything, and the oppression will be accepted as fate.

rulings.text: Each player loses 1 life. Then, starting with the active player and proceeding in turn order, each player chooses a card to discard (normally without seeing what other players have chosen) and all discards happen simultaneously. Then, starting with the active player and proceeding in turn order, each player chooses a creature to sacrifice (this time players can see what other players have chosen) and all sacrifices happen simultaneously. Then the process that happened for creatures is repeated for lands.

cards.originalText: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Stronghold Discipline
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature they control.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.
cards.originalText: Each player loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: As Phage drank their energy, a vague memory of Jeska stirred. Then she lost herself again in the joy of her victims' suffering.
cards.originalText: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Tragic Slip
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Unhallowed Pact
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave.

rulings.text: The card will return to the battlefield under your control only if it's still in the graveyard when Unhallowed Pact's ability resolves. If it's not (perhaps because an ability like undying has already returned it to the battlefield), nothing happens.
If Unhallowed Pact is enchanting a token creature, that creature can't return to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Vampire Hexmage
cards.text:
First strike
Sacrifice Vampire Hexmage: Remove all counters from target permanent.
cards.flavor: When the blood hunt lost its thrill, she looked for less tangible means of domination.

rulings.text: Any permanent can be targeted by the second ability, not just one with counters on it.
If all loyalty counters are removed from a planeswalker, that planeswalker is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Sacrifice Vampire Hexmage: Remove all counters from target permanent.

cards.name: Victimize
cards.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

rulings.text: You must choose two targets. You can't cast Victimize targeting only one creature card.
The creature you sacrifice isn't chosen until Victimize resolves. You can't return the creature you sacrifice because it will still be on the battlefield at the time targets are chosen.
As Victimize resolves, you must sacrifice a creature if able. You can't change your mind and choose not to sacrifice anything.

If one of the targeted creature cards is an illegal target (for instance, because it has left your graveyard before Victimize resolves), you'll still sacrifice a creature and put the other card onto the battlefield. If both are illegal targets, Victimize won't resolve. You won't sacrifice a creature.
Victimize can be used to put both parts of the B.F.M. onto the battlefield at once.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Wakedancer
cards.text: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.
cards.originalText: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Zombie Goliath
cards.flavor:
"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

cards.name: Barbed Shocker
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Barbed Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in their hand, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor: Fervid shamans willingly submit to shockers in hopes of glimpsing the fortunes of the future.

rulings.text: The number of cards the player draws is equal to the number of cards they discarded, not the amount of damage dealt by Barbed Shocker.

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
Whenever Barbed Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Boldwyr Intimidator
cards.text:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Now everyone knows what you are."

rulings.text: Coward is a new creature type.
Each of the activated abilities replaces all creature types the affected creature may have had.
Note that the exact wording of this card has changed since it was printed in the _Future Sight_(TM) set, but its functionality is the same.

foreignNames.name: ボールドウィアの威嚇者

cards.originalText:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.

cards.name: Brimstone Volley
cards.text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to any target.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that permanent or player instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.originalText:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Chartooth Cougar
cards.text:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Mountaincycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Mountain card. After you find a Mountain card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Mountaincycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Mountaincycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Mountaincycling from being activated.

Mountaincycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Mountaincycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Mountain land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Mountain card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Cinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.name: Deathforge Shaman
cards.text:
Multikicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Deathforge Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to twice the number of times it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Deathforge Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of times it was kicked.

cards.name: Flaring Flame-Kin
cards.text: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: A flame-kin is always formidable, but feeding its fire with a sorcerous gift grants it the power to devastate armies.
cards.originalText: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Flowstone Blade
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Heartless Hidetsugu
cards.text: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.
cards.flavor: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.
cards.originalText: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.

cards.name: Heckling Fiends
cards.text: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.

rulings.text: The creature's controller still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks.

If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

cards.name: Lizard Warrior
cards.flavor: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

cards.name: Mana Geyser
cards.text: Add {R} for each tapped land your opponents control.
cards.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.
cards.originalText: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.

cards.name: Orcish Cannonade
cards.text:
Orcish Cannonade deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, orcish captain
cards.originalText:
Orcish Cannonade deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Pitchburn Devils
cards.text: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.
cards.originalText: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Power of Fire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Skitter of Lizards
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Haste
Skitter of Lizards enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Haste
Skitter of Lizards enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

cards.name: Torch Fiend
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Uncontrollable Anger
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Vent Sentinel
cards.text:
Defender
{1}{R}, {T}: Vent Sentinel deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of creatures with defender you control.
cards.flavor:
"Zendikar fortifies itself against the Great Threat, making sentries of sky, sea, and stone."
—The War Diaries
cards.originalText:
Defender
{1}{R}, {T}: Vent Sentinel deals damage to target player equal to the number of creatures with defender you control.

cards.name: Volcanic Fallout
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"How can we outrun the sky?"
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

rulings.text: Volcanic Fallout can be targeted by spells that try to counter it (such as Countersquall). Those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Volcanic Fallout won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.

cards.originalText:
Volcanic Fallout can't be countered.
Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Wrap in Flames
cards.text: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries

rulings.text: You may target zero, one, two, or three creatures.

The "can't block" effect applies to each of the targeted creatures — and only those creatures — even if Wrap in Flames deals no damage to one or more of them (due to a prevention effect, for example) or Wrap in Flames deals damage to a different creature (due to a redirection effect).
If any of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Wrap in Flames resolves, it won't be dealt damage and will be able to block. The other targeted creatures will still be affected.

cards.originalText: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor:
"Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Copperhorn Scout
cards.text: Whenever Copperhorn Scout attacks, untap each other creature you control.
cards.flavor: Fangren spur may sound louder, but Viridian resurgents claim that the horn of the vorrac creates a truer, more inspiring note.

rulings.text: As Copperhorn Scout's ability resolves, you'll untap each other creature you control regardless of whether that creature was attacking.
Untapping an attacking creature doesn't cause it to stop attacking.

cards.originalText: Whenever Copperhorn Scout attacks, untap each other creature you control.

cards.name: Echoing Courage
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.

rulings.text: Echoing Courage has only one target. Other creatures with that name are not targeted. For example, a creature with protection from green will still get +2/+2 if it has the same name as the target creature.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Echoing Courage tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. No creatures get +2/+2.

The name of a creature token is the same as the creature types it was created with, unless the token is a copy of another creature or the effect that created the token specifically gave it a different name. For example, a 1/1 Cat Soldier creature token is named "Cat Soldier."
A face-down creature has no name, so it can't share a name with anything. This includes other creatures with no name.

cards.originalText: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elephant Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature dies, create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
cards.flavor: Nature's strength outlives the strong.

rulings.text: If Elephant Guide enchants an opponent's creature, you get the Elephant when that creature dies.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature dies, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Exploration
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.flavor:
"Only when we journey into the unknown can we find the impossible."
—Cyrul the Wanderer
cards.originalText: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.

cards.name: Gamekeeper
cards.text: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

rulings.text: If you have no creature cards in your library, all the cards from your library end up in your graveyard and you do not get to put a creature onto the battlefield.
Exiling this card is optional.

cards.originalText: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.name: Gnarlid Pack
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Gnarlid Pack enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Gnarlid Pack enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Howling Wolf
cards.text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Hunger of the Howlpack
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Morbid — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
cards.originalText:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Morbid — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Hydra Omnivore
cards.text: Whenever Hydra Omnivore deals combat damage to an opponent, it deals that much damage to each other opponent.
cards.flavor:
"We should learn from the hydra. It never plays favorites; it devours everyone equally."
—Thrass, elder druid

rulings.text: The damage dealt by Hydra Omnivore as a result of its triggered ability is not combat damage (and doesn't cause the ability to trigger again).

cards.originalText: Whenever Hydra Omnivore deals combat damage to an opponent, it deals that much damage to each other opponent.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Nature's Claim
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

rulings.text: If the target artifact or enchantment is an illegal target when Nature's Claim tries to resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No one gains any life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.

cards.name: Pelakka Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Provoke
cards.text:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Never start a fight you can't finish."
—Padril, council guardian

rulings.text: You can target an untapped creature.

cards.originalText:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Relic Crush
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment and up to one other target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: There are many ruins, but there used to be many more.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment and up to one other target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Respite
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.

cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
cards.text: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become a part of the forest after death.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.

cards.name: Sporecap Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"They don't move much, but then again, if you get caught in its web, it has all the time in the world to get to you."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter
cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Squirrel Nest
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token."
cards.flavor: In the treetops, unseen by many, lurks chittering, skittering death.

rulings.text: The land receives this ability and not the actual text. Text-changing effects can be used on this Aura, but would not change this effect if cast on the land.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token onto the battlefield."

cards.name: Terastodon
cards.text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

cards.originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Wolfbriar Elemental
cards.text:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Wrap in Vigor
cards.text: Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Some nature mages unknowingly took advantage of the temporal energies still swirling on Dominaria. What they mistook for healing magic was in fact the manipulation of time.

rulings.text: Wrap in Vigor sets up a separate regeneration shield on each creature you control at the time it resolves.

cards.originalText: Regenerate each creature you control.

cards.name: Basandra, Battle Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: "Why listen to the mumblings of wizards when the lash speaks true?"

rulings.text: While Basandra, Battle Seraph is on the battlefield, players can't cast any spells during the combat phase, including permanent spells with flash.
Players may still activate abilities during combat.

If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

foreignNames.name: 戦いの熾天使、バサンドラ

cards.originalText:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

cards.name: Decimate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.
cards.flavor: Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .

rulings.text: You no longer need four distinct targets for Decimate. If the spell or ability uses the word target in multiple places, the same object or player can be chosen once for each instance of the word "target." For example, you could choose Tree of Tales for both the artifact and the land. You still need a legal target enchantment and creature as well.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.

cards.name: Dimir Doppelganger
cards.text: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card, except it has this ability.
cards.flavor: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

rulings.text: This creature becomes an exact copy of a copied card, except that it also has Dimir Doppelganger's activated ability. If it becomes a copy of a different creature card, the new copy will overwrite the old copy.

A permanent's ability that refers to cards the creature exiled (such as Sisters of Stone Death's third ability) only affects cards exiled by other abilities intrinsic to that permanent (such as Sisters of Stone Death's second ability). Suppose that (a) Dimir Doppelganger copies Arc-Slogger, (b) its "deal 2 damage" ability is activated, and then (c) it copies Sisters of Stone Death. Creatures exiled by Arc-Slogger's ability can't be returned with Sisters of Stone Death's ability.

foreignNames.name: ディミーアのドッペルゲンガー

cards.originalText: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card and gains this ability.

cards.name: Edric, Spymaster of Trest
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I am not at liberty to reveal my sources, but I can assure you, the price on your head is high."

rulings.text: A creature controlled by an opponent that deals combat damage to another opponent will cause Edric's ability to trigger. The creature's controller chooses whether to draw a card.
When a creature you control deals combat damage to one of your opponents, you may draw a card.

foreignNames.name: トレストの密偵長、エドリック

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may draw a card.

cards.name: Fires of Yavimaya
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Yavimaya lights the quickest path to battle.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mirari's Wake
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
cards.flavor: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Mortify
cards.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Many who cross Sorin's path come down with a sudden and fatal case of being-in-the-way-of-a-millennia-old-vampire.

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an enchantment, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

cards.name: Pernicious Deed
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice Pernicious Deed: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor: "Yawgmoth," Freyalise whispered as she set the bomb, "now you will pay for your treachery."

rulings.text: If a permanent has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
A token has a converted mana cost of 0 unless it is copying something else.

cards.originalText: {X}, Sacrifice Pernicious Deed: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.name: Sky Spirit
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Spiritmonger
cards.text:
Whenever Spiritmonger deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Spiritmonger.
{B}: Regenerate Spiritmonger.
{G}: Spiritmonger becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Spiritmonger deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Spiritmonger.
{B}: Regenerate Spiritmonger.
{G}: Spiritmonger becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Spontaneous Combustion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Spontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Spontaneous Combustion, sacrifice a creature.
Spontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Wood Sage
cards.text: {T}: Choose a creature card name. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Altar of Dementia
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Deathrender

rulings.text: If the creature you put onto the battlefield can't be equipped by Deathrender (due to protection from artifacts, for example), the creature enters the battlefield but Deathrender remains unattached.

cards.name: Explorer's Scope
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Fireshrieker
cards.text:
Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
cards.text:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.
cards.originalText:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

cards.name: Peace Strider
cards.text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman
cards.originalText: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Reito Lantern
cards.text: {3}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.
cards.originalText: {3}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Runed Servitor
cards.text: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.
cards.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.
cards.originalText: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.
